title: Citi Paraguay Celebrates Its 54th Anniversary
summary: Asunción, Paraguay - On Sept. 22, Citi Paraguay marks 54 years of uninterrupted operations here. The institution opened its doors in this country in 1958 and has more than five decades of successful operations and experience behind it in Paraguay.
tag-3: Asunción, Paraguay – On Sept. 22, Citi Paraguay marks 54 years of uninterrupted operations here. The institution opened its doors in this country in 1958 and has more than five decades of successful operations and experience behind it in Paraguay.
tag-4: Citi is currently the only private financial institution in Paraguay that operates as a direct branch of its parent company, and it is the country's oldest bank. It is a member of Citigroup, the financial corporation that is celebrating 200 years of global operations this year. Citi has a presence in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions and serves approximately 200 million client accounts around the world.
tag-5: "We are celebrating a new anniversary in this country thanks to the trust and loyalty of our clients and the hard work and commitment of our employees," remarked Jeronimo Nasser, Director and General Manager of Citi Paraguay. "Many important milestones have characterized our presence in Paraguay, which dates back more than five decades, and we have a rich story to tell. This latest anniversary renews our commitment to the country's development and is an impetus for us to continue to work on our long-term projects."
tag-6: Citi has distinguished itself in a number of ways in Paraguay. It was the first bank to implement a system of personalized customer service in the 1960s. Automatic teller machines, used around the world since 1967, made their first appearance in this country thanks to Citi, which was the first bank to introduce them to the local financial system. Citi also participated in financing the construction of Itaipú, the world's largest hydroelectric dam. It is the only bank with an established program to support financial education, which has been in place for more than 15 years and benefited more than 50,000 people. In late 1999, Citi inaugurated the first smart building in Paraguay, Citicenter, in Villa Morra. It is the country's only bank with its own cultural center, which has provided cultural programming in the community for the last 13 years. Finally, the Government of Paraguay recently chose Citibank to coordinate the country's first international bond issue.
tag-7: As it does everywhere in the world, Citi applies the experience, commitment and talent of its workforce to offer clients in Paraguay the best in banking products and services. Today, Citi has two customer service centers: one at the bank's headquarters in Villa Morra, and an Operating Center in the Asunción microcenter. It also has a VIP lounge at Silvio Pettirossi International Airport, the terminal's most modern and well-equipped VIP facility.
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citigroup provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
